info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 8:47PM CDT until July 5 at 1:27PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas...
Concho River At Paint Rock affecting Concho County.
For the Concho River...including Paint Rock...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Concho River at Paint Rock.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding will occur. A few structures near the banks of the river in Paint Rock will be threatened. Low water crossings and secondary roads will be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 29.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 24.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Friday was 29.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 13.0 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.3 feet on 09/09/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
